definition: a bunch of nonsense/verbose and rambling
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
variant of 廢|废[fei4]/disabled
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: Who would like to sit there listening to your beating your gums?
sentences.chinese: 谁愿意坐在那里听你废话连篇呢？

sentences.english: The entire report was piffle from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 整个报告从头至尾废话连篇。

sentences.english: Our teacher always beats his gums, we will go asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我们老师总是废话连篇，我们都快睡着了。

sentences.english: The manager is such a windbag.
sentences.chinese: 这个主管真是废话连篇。

sentences.english: "Chain talkers, " someone had sourly called them thirty years before.
sentences.chinese: 三十年前有人刻薄地称他们为“废话连篇的空谈家。”

sentences.english: That book is a load of rubbish.
Who would enjoy sitting there listening to your beating your gums?
sentences.chinese: 谁喜欢坐在那里听你的废话连篇？

sentences.english: These reports are total and utter rubbish.
Thank you for this bizarre and amusing bit of nonsense news.
sentences.chinese: 为这个离奇且有点儿废话连篇的新闻，向您表示感谢。

definition: long-winded/verbose
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to talk nonsense (idiom)/frivolous talk
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
to chatter/to babble
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
confused/disorderly/incoherent
long-winded empty talk
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
(of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
incoherent (writing or speech)/nonsensical/a load of crap
irrelevant/beside the point
long-winded/wordy/troublesome/pesky/also pr. [luo1 suo1]
